alloy.description:
# Various Alloy settings. For backwards compatibility with the grafana-agent
# chart, this field may also be called "agent". Naming this field "agent" is
# deprecated and will be removed in a future release.

enabled.description: Deploy Alloy in a cluster to allow for load distribution.
enabled.title: enabled

name.description: Name for the Alloy cluster. Used for differentiating between clusters.
name.title: name

portName.description: Name for the port used for clustering, useful if running inside an Istio Mesh
portName.title: portName

content.description: Content to assign to the new ConfigMap.  This is passed into `tpl` allowing for templating from values.
content.title: content

create.title: create

key.description: Key in ConfigMap to get config from.
key.title: key

name.description: Name of existing ConfigMap to use. Used when create is false.
name.title: name

enableHttpServerPort.description: Enables Grafana Alloy container's http server port.
enableHttpServerPort.title: enableHttpServerPort

enableReporting.description:
Enables sending Grafana Labs anonymous usage stats to help improve Grafana
Alloy.
enableReporting.title: enableReporting

envFrom.description: Maps all the keys on a ConfigMap or Secret as environment variables. https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/generated/kubernetes-api/v1.24/#envfromsource-v1-core
envFrom.title: envFrom

extraArgs.description: Extra args to pass to `alloy run`: https://grafana.com/docs/alloy/latest/reference/cli/run/
extraArgs.title: extraArgs

extraEnv.description: Extra environment variables to pass to the Alloy container.
extraEnv.title: extraEnv

extraPorts.description: Extra ports to expose on the Alloy container.
extraPorts.title: extraPorts

hostAliases.description: Host aliases to add to the Alloy container.
hostAliases.title: hostAliases

lifecycle.description: Set lifecycle hooks for the Grafana Alloy container.
lifecycle.title: lifecycle

listenAddr.description:
Address to listen for traffic on. 0.0.0.0 exposes the UI to other
containers.
listenAddr.title: listenAddr

listenPort.description: Port to listen for traffic on.
listenPort.title: listenPort

listenScheme.description: Scheme is needed for readiness probes. If enabling tls in your configs, set to "HTTPS"
listenScheme.title: listenScheme

livenessProbe.description: Set livenessProbe for the Grafana Alloy container.
livenessProbe.title: livenessProbe

dockercontainers.description:
Mount /var/lib/docker/containers from the host into the container for log
collection.
dockercontainers.title: dockercontainers

extra.description:
Extra volume mounts to add into the Grafana Alloy container. Does not
affect the watch container.
extra.title: extra

varlog.description: Mount /var/log from the host into the container for log collection.

resources.description: Resource requests and limits to apply to the Grafana Alloy container.
resources.title: resources

securityContext.description: Security context to apply to the Grafana Alloy container.
securityContext.title: securityContext

stabilityLevel.description:
Minimum stability level of components and behavior to enable. Must be
one of "experimental", "public-preview", or "generally-available".
stabilityLevel.title: stabilityLevel

storagePath.description:
Path to where Grafana Alloy stores data (for example, the Write-Ahead Log).
By default, data is lost between reboots.

uiPathPrefix.description: Base path where the UI is exposed.
uiPathPrefix.title: uiPathPrefix

alloy-operator.description:
The Alloy Operator is a Kubernetes Operator that manages Alloy instances and their lifecycle.
To see all valid settings, please see the [Alloy Operator documentation](https://github.com/grafana/alloy-operator/tree/main/charts/alloy-operator).

enabled.description:
Utilize a Helm Hook to wait for all Alloy instances to be removed before uninstalling the Alloy Operator.
This ensures that all Alloy instances are properly cleaned up before the operator is removed.

Annotations to apply to the Pod for the Helm Hook to wait for all Alloy instances to be removed before

Labels to apply to the Pod for the Helm Hook to wait for all Alloy instances to be removed before uninstalling

tolerations.description: Tolerations to apply to the Helm Hook that ensures that Alloy instances are removed during uninstall.
tolerations.title: tolerations

Requires a destination that supports metrics.

Overrides metrics.autoDiscover.scrapeInterval

Annotation for overriding the scrape timeout for this service or pod. Value should be a duration like "15s, 1m".
Overrides metrics.autoDiscover.scrapeTimeout

apiServer.description: API Server metrics gather information about the Kubernetes API Server.

enabled.description: (bool) Scrape metrics from the API Server.
enabled.title: enabled

extraDiscoveryRules.description:
Rule blocks to be added to the discovery.relabel component for the API Server.
These relabeling rules are applied pre-scrape against the targets from service discovery.
Before the scrape, any remaining target labels that start with `__` (i.e. `__meta_kubernetes*`) are dropped.
([docs](https://grafana.com/docs/alloy/latest/reference/components/discovery/discovery.relabel/#rule-block))
extraDiscoveryRules.title: extraDiscoveryRules

extraMetricProcessingRules.description:
Rule blocks to be added to the prometheus.relabel component for the API Server.
These relabeling rules are applied post-scrape against the metrics returned from the scraped target, no `__meta*` labels are present.
([docs](https://grafana.com/docs/alloy/latest/reference/components/prometheus/prometheus.relabel/#rule-block))
extraMetricProcessingRules.title: extraMetricProcessingRules

jobLabel.title: jobLabel

maxCacheSize.description:
Sets the max_cache_size for the API Server prometheus.relabel component.
This should be at least 2x-5x your largest scrape target or samples appended rate.
([docs](https://grafana.com/docs/alloy/latest/reference/components/prometheus/prometheus.relabel/#arguments))
Overrides metrics.maxCacheSize
maxCacheSize.title: maxCacheSize

@ section -- General

attributes.description:
profile_port: 6060
open_port: 8443
routes:
  unmatched: heuristic
log_level: info
otel_traces_export:
  endpoint: http://grafana-agent:4318
# or alternatively use
grafana:
  otlp:
    cloud_zone: prod-eu-west-0
    cloud_instance_id: 123456
    cloud_api_key:

  enable: true

ebpf.description: Settings for gathering profiles using eBPF

annotationSelectors.description:
Select pods to profile based on pod annotations.
Example: `color: "green"` will select pods with the annotation `color="green"`.
Example with multiple values: `color: ["blue", "green"]` will select pods with the annotation `color="blue"` or
`color="green"`.
annotationSelectors.title: annotationSelectors

annotations.description:
Configure the annotations that will control how the targets are discovered and how profiles are collected.
All annotations will be `<prefix>/cpu.ebpf.<action>`, for example, to "enable" collecting profiles using eBPF, set
the annotation `profiles.grafana.com/cpu.ebpf.scrape: "true"` on the pod.

enable.description: The annotation action for enabling or disabling collecting of profiles with eBPF.
enable.title: enable

annotations.title: annotations

demangle.description: C++ demangle mode. Available options are: none, simplified, templates, full
demangle.title: demangle

enabled.description: Gather profiles using eBPF
enabled.title: enabled

excludeNamespaces.description: Which namespaces to exclude looking for pods.
excludeNamespaces.title: excludeNamespaces

extraDiscoveryRules.description:
Rule blocks to be added to the discovery.relabel component for eBPF profile sources.
These relabeling rules are applied pre-scrape against the targets from service discovery.
Before the scrape, any remaining target labels that start with `__` (i.e. `__meta_kubernetes*`) are dropped.
([docs](https://grafana.com/docs/alloy/latest/reference/components/discovery/discovery.relabel/#rule-block))
extraDiscoveryRules.title: extraDiscoveryRules

labelSelectors.description:
Select pods to profile based on pod labels.
Example: `app.kubernetes.io/name: myapp` will select pods with the label `app.kubernetes.io/name=myapp`.
Example with multiple values: `app.kubernetes.io/name: [myapp, myapp2]` will select pods with the label
`app.kubernetes.io/name=myapp` or `app.kubernetes.io/name=myapp2`.
labelSelectors.title: labelSelectors

namespaces.description: Select pods to profile based on their namespaces.
namespaces.title: namespaces

targetingScheme.description:
How to target pods for collecting profiles with eBPF. Options are `all` and `annotation`. If using `all`, all
Kubernetes pods will be targeted for collecting profiles, and you can exclude certain pods by setting the
`profiles.grafana.com/cpu.ebpf.enabled="false"` annotation on that pod. If using `annotation`, only pods with the
`profiles.grafana.com/cpu.ebpf.enabled="true"` annotation will have profiles collected with eBPF.
targetingScheme.title: targetingScheme

We usually recommend not to specify default resources and to leave this as a conscious
choice for the user. This also increases chances charts run on environments with little
resources, such as Minikube. If you do want to specify resources, uncomment the following
lines, adjust them as necessary, and remove the curly braces after 'resources:'.
limits:
  cpu: 100m
  memory: 128Mi
requests:
  cpu: 100m
  memory: 128Mi

Rule blocks to be added to the prometheus.operator.podmonitors component for PodMonitors.
These relabeling rules are applied pre-scrape against the targets from service discovery.

podMonitor.description:
PodMonitor defines monitoring for a set of pods.
ref. https://github.com/prometheus-operator/prometheus-operator/blob/main/Documentation/api-reference/api.md#podmonitor
Using a PodMonitor may be preferred in some environments where there is very large number
of Windows Exporter endpoints (1000+) behind a single service.
The PodMonitor is disabled by default. When switching from ServiceMonitor to PodMonitor,
the time series resulting from the configuration through PodMonitor may have different labels.
For instance, there will not be the service label any longer which might
affect PromQL queries selecting that label.

Before the scrape, any remaining target labels that start with `__` (i.e. `__meta_kubernetes*`) are dropped.
([docs](https://grafana.com/docs/alloy/latest/reference/components/discovery/discovery.relabel/#rule-block))

windows-exporter.description: Windows Exporter metrics gathers hardware information about Windows nodes.

config.default:
collectors:
  enabled: cpu,container,logical_disk,memory,net,os
collector:
  service:
    include: "containerd|kubelet"
config.title: config

deploy.description: Deploy Windows Exporter. Set to false if your cluster already has Windows Exporter deployed.
deploy.title: deploy

enabled.description: Scrape node metrics
enabled.title: enabled

extraDiscoveryRules.description:
Rule blocks to be added to the discovery.relabel component for Windows Exporter.
These relabeling rules are applied pre-scrape against the targets from service discovery.
Before the scrape, any remaining target labels that start with __ (i.e. __meta_kubernetes*) are dropped.
([docs](https://grafana.com/docs/alloy/latest/reference/components/discovery/discovery.relabel/#rule-block))
extraDiscoveryRules.title: extraDiscoveryRules

extraMetricProcessingRules.description:
Rule blocks to be added to the prometheus.relabel component for Windows Exporter metrics.
These relabeling rules are applied post-scrape against the metrics returned from the scraped target, no `__meta*` labels are present.
([docs](https://grafana.com/docs/alloy/latest/reference/components/prometheus/prometheus.relabel/#rule-block))
extraMetricProcessingRules.title: extraMetricProcessingRules

jobLabel.description: The value for the job label.
jobLabel.title: jobLabel

labelMatchers.description: Labels used to select the Windows Exporter pods.
labelMatchers.title: labelMatchers

maxCacheSize.description:
Sets the max_cache_size for the Windows Exporter prometheus.relabel component.
This should be at least 2x-5x your largest scrape target or samples appended rate.
([docs](https://grafana.com/docs/alloy/latest/reference/components/prometheus/prometheus.relabel/#arguments))
Overrides global.maxCacheSize
maxCacheSize.title: maxCacheSize
